artifact.content: Name: Originate/Receive VoIP Call Authors: M4 Events: The user places an outgoing call to another user System: Caller, Callee, System Actors: User (Caller), User (Callee) Overview: This use case captures the process of one user making a call to another user, establishing a connection, and engaging in conversation

Name: Connect a VoIP Phone Authors: M1 Events: Administrator/User plugs in a VoIP telephone set. System: VoIP Telephone Set (phone) and Console. Actors: Administrator/User (initiator) Overview: This use case captures the process of Administrator/User plugging in a phone and the initialization of VoIP telephone service.

Name: Disconnect a VoIP Phone Authors: M1 Events: Administrator/User unplugs a VoIP telephone set. System: VoIP Telephone Set (phone) and Console Actors: Administrator/User (initiator) Overview: This use case captures the process of Administrator/User unplugging a phone and the finalization of VoIP telephone service.

Name: Disable/Enable Phone Authors: M1 Events: The administrator selects the Disable/Enable Phone option from the Maintenance tab. System: Console, and VoIP Telephone Set Actors: Administrator Overview: This use case captures the process of the administrator disabling a phone or re-enabling a disabled phone. Once a phone is disabled, it can no longer be used by or assigned to a user.

Name: Add/Edit User Account Authors: M3 Events: The administrator selects the option to add or edit a user account from the administrative console. System: Console Actors: Administrator Overview: This use case captures the process of the administrator adding a new user account or editing an existing user account for the VoIP telephone system. The administrator defines the user�s name, contact information, billing plan, filter options, phone IP, and phone number [optional].

Name: Cancel User Account Authors: M3 Events: The administrator selects the option to cancel a user account from the administrative console. System: Console Actors: Administrator Overview: This use case captures the process of the administrator canceling a user account from the VoIP telephone system.

Name: Add/Edit Billing Plan Authors: M1 Events: Administrator selects the option to add a new billing plan or edit an existing billing plan from the administrative console. System: Console and Phone Manager (PM) Actors: Administrator (initiator) Overview: This use case captures the process of Administrator adding a new billing plan to or editing an existing billing plan of the VoIP telephone system. Administrator defines/changes the regular rate, the discount periods during which discount rates apply, and the discount rates for each of the n discount periods defined.

Name: Delete Billing Plan Authors: M1 Events: Administrator selects the option to delete existing billing plans from the administrative console. System: Console and Phone Manager (PM) Actors: Administrator (initiator) Overview: This use case captures the process of Administrator deleting existing billing plans from the VoIP telephone system. Only inactive billing plans can be deleted. A billing plan is inactive if it is not associated with any user account.

Name: Run test Authors: M2 Events: The administrator selects a specific test to run on the system. System: Console Actors: Administrator, Time Overview: The use case provides the general process that the system goes through in order to test various aspects of the system.

Name: View Bill Authors: M2 Events: The administrator selects the view option for a specific user�s bill System: The Console Actors: Administrator Overview: This use case captures the process of viewing/printing one bill of a specific user to the screen of the administrative console.

Name: Logon (to Admin Console) Authors: M3 Events: The administrator opens the administration application that runs on the administrative console. System: Account Manager; Console Manager Actors: Administrator Overview: This use case captures the process of the administrator starting up the Administration Console application and logging in as the system administrator.

Name: Log Off (Admin Console) Authors: M3 Events: The administrator chooses to close the Administration Console application. System: Account Manager; Console Manager Actors: Administrator Overview: This use case captures the process of the administrator closing the administration console application for the VoIP telephone system.

Name: Reset Phone Software Authors: M2 Events: The administrator selects to reset the software on a user�s phone through the administrative console. System: Console, VoIP Telephone Set Actors: Administrator Overview: This use case captures the process of the administrator resetting or reinitializing the software that is running on a VoIP phone that is registered within the VoIP network. The purpose of this use case is that a serious error could have occurred on the VoIP phone or the user wishes to reset their phone�s settings.

Name: Balance System Load Authors: M2 Events: The user changes the maximum number of simultaneous connections that the system can handle. System: Console Actors: Administrator Overview: This use case captures the process of the administrator attempting to limit the number of simultaneous connections (phone calls, or other client connections) in the VoIP network.

Name: Pay Bill Authors: M4 Events: Administrator selects the option to enter a user�s bill payment System: Console Actors: Administrator (initiator) Overview: This use case captures the process of Administrator adding a new billing plan to or editing an existing billing plan of the VoIP telephone system. Administrator defines/changes the regular rate, the discount periods during which discount rates apply, and the discount rates for each of the n discount periods defined.

Name: Add/Edit Admin Accounts Authors: M4 Events: Super Administrator can add or edit an administrator account System: Console Actors: Super-Administrator (initiator) Overview: The Super-admin specifies a username and password for a general admin, which can manipulate user accounts

Name: Delete Admin Accounts Authors: M4 Events: Super Administrator can delete an administrator account System: Console Actors: Super Administrator (initiator) Overview: The super-admin deletes an administrator account.

Name: Suspend/Reactivate User Account Authors: M3 Events: The administrator selects to suspend or activate a user account. System: Console Actors: Administrator Overview: This use case captures the process of the administrator suspending a user account or reactivating a previously suspended user account. Upon reactivating a user account, the administrator defines the phone IP address to be associated with this account.

Name: Change Billing Period Authors: M4 Events: The administrator determines the billing period for a specific user�s account System: Console Actors: Administrator Overview: This use case captures the process of the Administrator defining the billing interval, as well as billing start date, mapped to a specific user account.

Name: Print Bill Authors: M2 Events: End of the current billing, when a user account is cancelled or a change in billing period causes the current time to be at or beyond the end of the new billing period. System: Console Actors: Time Overview: This use case captures the process of printing the user�s bill after billing period has expired, when a user account has been cancelled, or a change in the billing period causes the current time to be at or beyond the end of the new billing period.

Name: View Call History Authors: M1 Events: Administrator selects the option to view the call history. System: Console Actors: Administrator Overview: This use case captures the process of administrator viewing and/or printing the call history of a specific user for a specific period.
